Event.name: Rewards_and_punishments
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> (the punisher or rewarder) performs a <fen>Response_action</fen> on an <fen>Evaluee</fen> for a <fen>Reason</fen>, the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s actions or beliefs. <fen>Means</fen> and <fen>Instrument</fen> may also be indicated. The goal of the punishment/reward is to discourage/encourage the actions or beliefs. Words in this frame presuppose that a judgment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> has occurred and that the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is (or becomes) aware of the judgment. This judgment was performed by a cognizer which is either the same as the <fen>Agent</fen>, or, minimally, a representative of the same institution.
<ex><fex name="Agt">His</fex> <t>punishment</t> <fex name="Eval">of the prisoners</fex> was too harsh.</ex> <ex><fex name="Eval">Her</fex> <t>punishment</t> was too harsh.</ex> <ex>The <t>penalty</t> <fex name="Reas">for this crime</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Action">death</fex>. </ex> <ex>I believe that this behaviour should be subject to <t>disciplinary</t> <fex name="Action">action</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Evaluee
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is typically expressed as Object. <ex>The boss <t>rewarded</t> <fex name="Eval">you</fex> for your diligence.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Manner</fen> of performing the reward or punishment.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward. <ex>His parents <t>disciplined</t> him <fex name="Mns">by taking away his toys</fex>.</ex> <ex>The Bar Association <t>rewarded</t> her <fex name="Mns">by hosting a lunch in her honor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Reason
Arg.definition: <def-root>Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Agent</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g. <ex>I <t>punished</t> him <fex name="Reas">for his impudence</fex>.</ex></def-root >

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person doing the rewarding or punishing. <ex><fex name="Agt">Jake's</fex> <t>rewards</t> to his best workers were very generous.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Instrument</fen> with which the reward or punishment is carried out.</def-root>

Arg.name: Response_action
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reward or punishment given to the <fen>Evaluee</fen> by the <fen>Agent</fen>. <ex>If a person be guilty of impiety let him be <t>punished</t> <fex name="Action">with death</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> of the reward or punishment.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: punish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: inflict a penalty on someone for an offence

lexUnit.name: reward.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: something given in recognition of an achievement

lexUnit.name: discipline.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: punish or rebuke formally for an offence.

lexUnit.name: disciplinary.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: employed for punishing or rebuking formally for an offence.

lexUnit.name: penalty.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract

lexUnit.name: punitive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: inflicting or intended as punishment.

lexUnit.name: punishment [act].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of punishing or the state of being punished.
